glsa.title: GNU Tar: Directory traversal vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: A directory traversal vulnerability has been discovered in GNU Tar.

background.p: The GNU Tar program provides the ability to create tar archives, as well as various other kinds of manipulation.

description.p: Dmitry V. Levin discovered a directory traversal vulnerability in the contains_dot_dot() function in file src/names.c.

impact.p: By enticing a user to extract a specially crafted tar archive, a remote attacker could extract files to arbitrary locations outside of the specified directory with the permissions of the user running GNU Tar.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All GNU Tar users should upgrade to the latest version:
